headline: Quick Pork Fried Rice
description: A great recipe for leftover pork chops, roasts, or even chicken. Use cooked rice and a few vegetables for a colorful and hearty fried rice dish.
name: Quick Pork Fried Rice
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger, finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 2 teaspoons vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir mushrooms until liquid has evaporated, and mushrooms are browned, about 15 minutes. Set mushrooms aside.
Fluff cooked rice with a fork and stir in 1 tablespoon vegetable oil to separate the grains. Set aside.

Heat remaining 3 tablespoons vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Cook and stir pork, garlic, and ginger until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add celery, onion, and carrot. Cook and stir until vegetables begin to soften, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in bell pepper and cooked mushrooms just until combined.
Add in cooked rice, lightly tossing until rice is heated through and thoroughly combined with pork and vegetables. Stir in soy sauce, remove from heat, and sprinkle green onions over the top.

review.reviewBody: loved this! Just made it tonight. I added 2 eggs and a pinch of 5 spice powder. Thank you and yummy!
Great recipe, I used chicken instead of pork (not a pork eater) and added eggs which is a staple in fried rice. Absolutely loved it...

Great recipe! I did have leftover pork chops and fresh veggies that needed to be used up. Prep time was a bit longer, so I admit the canned veggies would speed things up! I did add bouillon in the water to flavor the rice. I agree with one reply to buy fresh ginger! I loved the sporadic bite of ginger, and topping off with fresh green onions! I will keep this recipe for other leftovers! thank you!
Good Stuff! Easy to make, and add whatever you want! I used lower sodium soy sauce and it was still great.

I love this one because it is SO easy--not so many complicated steps. As mentioned by other reviewers, I made some substitutions in the veggies. Didn't have any fresh ginger on hand, so I used a few dashes of ground ginger--worked great. I did add a little extra soy sauce after I dished it up. Picky hubby ate every bite!
good recipe for a quick meal
Super easy. Used up my pork chops and a bunch of leftover produce. I added fresh green beans. Made for lunch for my kids during virtual school
Was very good!! I added more pork than I should have . And also added more soy sauce .
Not bad. I added a little 5-spice powder.
You got great recipes, Love coming here!
Added tablespoon crushed red peppers! Was awesome!
It taste really authentic. The only thing that I did not do was put pepper in it. I put peas in it instead.
I’ve made this several times. I also add some sizzling siagon sauce when I add the soy sauce. Adds a little spice. I do skip the mushrooms.
Great recipe! Try using a little smoked sesame oil with your vegetable oil to give more Asian taste.
Fast and delicious! The only thing I lacked was the mushrooms. Since I often cook pork lion roast, this recipe works perfectly for leftovers.

This was the best pork fried rice recipe! One thing I noted, six cups of rice seems like way too much for six servings. I made the recipe as written except cut the rice down to 3 cups. That was the perfect amount of rice to vegetables and meat. I also added a spoonful of hoisin sauce per another reviewer's recommendation. The vegetables to meat proportion was perfect - except, feel free to increase the amount of mushrooms! I think I'll double them next time.
This has become our favorite way to use our leftover pork tenderloin after grilling one. Like mentioned before, the ginger is a key ingredient in my opinion.

No need for all that oil and could use a bit more soy and/or fish sauce. Otherwise, cleaned the fridge with leftover pork loin and rice no one seemed interested in eating in its original form. Voila! We gobbled it up with my lesser-oil version. I'll definitely make it again.

Very disappointed with recipe,Weird as exactly the recipe was written. When it was done it was white rice with some coloring from the vegetables absolutely no flavor had to add 3 tablespoons of extra soil sauce do you have any kind of color and flavor will never make again.

I always wonder what to do with leftover meat. This was a great way to repurpose the leftover pork chops. The fresh garlic was definitely key in this recipe. I added some mandarin oranges on the side and had a great dinner. Thank you!
Thanks, easy, used left over pork loin roast meat diced tiny, addition was snow peas diced small slivers...it was delicious!

I made it as my own house special fried rice with pulled pork and chicken, plus some already browned ground beef from the fridge. I had cooked cold rice from supper last night. I also added just a tiny smidge of Chinese five spice during the stir fry. Be VERY careful with that last spice as it will dominate if too much is used. How much is a smidge? Just a pinch between finger and thumb but maybe half of that. Try it. You will know if you used too much. Mine came out tasting great. That spice also adds aroma.
Enjoyed it. I added some sesame seeds & frozen peas.
Made it a couple months ago. My 18 yr old just walked in and requested it again. It's great!
This is now my go to recipe for left over pork. The kids request it! It’s easy and delicious!
Great for left over pork chops! I threw in a little brown sugar to sweeten the deal. Definitely a great way to use up left over/old veggies too!
Made this as a side to the beef and broccoli- super delicious- followed recipe exact accept for taking away veggies I didn’t like- reheated good too

I liked it with a couple of subs/tweaks: three eggs scrambled and added, powdered ginger instead, Mexican green onions instead: whites cooked in, greens garnished. Whole red bell pepper. Less mushroom.
Loved it! Omitted the onions and didn't have ginger on hand.

This is a very easy way to use up the odds and ends in your fridge. As written, this was tasty but not what I was hoping for... as suggested, I added a couple of eggs and ended up using four tablespoons of soy sauce based on taste... maybe I shouldn't have used low sodium soy sauce. in any case, this was an easy recipe and produced good results but did not approach what you will find at a good chinese restaurant.
The chops were tender and the fried rice was delicious!
Delicious! At the end, I made a well in the middle, put in 1 tablespoon of butter, after melted I added 2 eggs (scrambled).
great recipe we used with some left over pork.
Didn’t have any celery but made everything else as is... so delish and easy (minus all the cutting smile) thanks!
What a wonder recipe just like the restaurants

Deliscious but certainly not quick if you don't have all this stuff in the fridge ready to go. 
The rice = 20 min to cook and then another to cool down : cubed pork/ chicken ( who has that already in the fridge?) say another 10 min. if you have some cooked laying around. 
Fresh ginger chopped finely- another 10min. 
Now lets do cook the mushrooms for 15 minutes and unless you have 6 arms, 
Dice the celery, onion, carrot, and bell pepper ( mine doesn't come that way) and then the green onions. 
Now let's stir in the rice till its mixed with the pork and veggies and add the soy sauce and then green onions and mix that up thourghly - another 10 minutes at least.
This dish is much better than store bought - in fact its delish. Its worth the extra time making it!!!
Easy recipe and full of of flavors! The family loved it! I added diced boiled eggs as well, went well with it.
We liked this a lot. Didn’t add celery or red pepper and added peas instead. Also added a little sirracha to add some kick. It’s a very flexible recipe.
I did not have mushrooms or garlic. I think the rice I used was the wrong kind (short-grain instead of long or medium), but it was tasty and easy.

Excellent I definitely added more soy sauce which I know is bad but I think it is because I am used to Chinese take-out which is usually heavy on the salt. One other thing I did was cook the celery first and then onion because celery takes the longest to cook. I don’t like it crunchy. Really tasty!
Great recipe! I added more soy sauce, about 1/4 c. The ginger made it pop. I didn’t have green onion, I used a yellow onion chopped and threw in frozen peas
it doesn't really fit my taste for fried rice but it was ok

Great recipe! Turned out great. One thing we did differently is adding a couple scrambled eggs once we stirred in the rice. Also added about 1/4 tsp of sesame oil and an extra tsp of soy sauce. I feel this is a great dish that is hard to mess up. This was my first attempt at any sort of fried rice and my family was quite pleased with the results.

Very good indeed! I added 1/4 cup chicken broth and then let simmer until most of the liquid was gone. I didn’t have any carrots on hand so I used chopped broccoli instead. Great way to use up left over pork meat. Will make again.
I used chicken instead of pork and I cut the veggies. I basically made it fried rice with chicken. Kept the green onions though.
My first time at trying any Chinese food, it was good I will make this again making some tweaks the next time and I am sure that it will be even better.

I made this last night with my leftover pork roast. It was a big hit with my family and I will make it again. Listening to other reviews I added 3 Tbls of soy sauce, but I was worried that it might be too sharp or too salty so I added a tsp of brown sugar to the soy sauce before adding it to the recipe . I also added a tsp of sesame seed oil for flavor. The vegetables (especially the celery) took longer than 3-4 minutes to soften, more like 15 minutes. Next time I will take that into consideration in the timing of the meal.

I loved this recipe! It was the first time I made Pork Fried Rice and it turned out great! The only thing I did differently was to add mushroom soy sauce instead of the regular just before serving. Yum! I will definitely make this again.
Very good. I'm not a fan of ginger so omitted this ingredient. Will prepare this dish again for sure.
Delicious recipe!!
I made this and it turned out great. It was a big hit with my family. The only change I made was on the soy sauce. I added about an eighth cup of soy sauce.

This recipe worked out really well for my family. Easy to follow and flexible to allow our use of what veggies we had on hand. 
Thanks!

Excellent way to use up pork chops. Made a few changes. Used fresh mushrooms. Added an egg. Also replaced the vegetable oil with sesame oil. Will make again. I was surprised at how well it turned out (that’s not because of the recipe but my cooking ability)
Very good

I added pork roast. Red and Green Peppers.

No chilli sauce.

I will certainly make it again
lots of veggies work. added 2 eggs scrambled
This is the best fried rice I’ve made. Next time I’ll add some scrambled egg and bean sprouts, just because I thought it could use a bit more protein and I love bean sprouts!

I made this as directed. My only cheat was picking up precooked rice from our local Asian shop and I found it was already oiled. I used 3 Tbsp soy sauce and make sure you use FRESH ginger!! ( I always keep fresh ginger in my freezer) Don’t overcook the veggies. Sprinkled it with a little black pepper. My husband loved it! Definitely would make again!
Quite tasty and good use of leftovers. I added some fresh asparagus that I had and needed to use.

This was a great way to use leftover pork roast. I used powdered Ginger because that is what I had on hand. I am interested in rice bowls as a way to prepare meals ahead to freeze for use on busy weeknights; I will definitely be making this again for that purpose.
Delicious! Followed recipe exactly.

I made this rice and since we didn't have any pork, I used leftover rotisserie chicken. I used Bragg "Liquid Aminos" instead of soy sauce as it is healthier and tastes just like it. It turned out really, really good. My husband and I loved it.
Very tasty & easy. Once the ingredients are prepped, it comes together quickly. I tossed in about a cup of frozen peas along with the other veggies. I'll definitely be making this again.
Turned out great! I made a few changes. I added peas, didn’t have any green onions, and put a little dash of hoisin sauce when I added the soya sauce. Husband gives it two thumbs up!
Made as directed no changes..Was DELISH //Whole Family enjoyed.
Just added a bit of hoisin and used a little more pork than called for. It was excellent.
My family really like this recipe. So easy really. I used another reviewers idea of adding a small amt of oil to the cooked, then cooled rice, It really helped with fluffing up the rice.

We enjoyed this fried rice. I halved the recipe and made the rice the day before so it was cooled properly. I had made a babequed pork tenderloin for wonton soup, I used the leftover meat for the rice. My family enjoyed, I added some Sambal Oleck to make spicier, served with wonton soup and eggrolls.
#AllrecipesAllstarsCanada
#LunarNewYear

Turned out great! My whole family doesn’t eat mushrooms, only me, so I didn’t add them. I also did not have any bell peppers. Even if I did, though, I probably would not have added them as I’m not usually a fan of adding bell peppers to my cooked dishes. Great meal, quick and simple. And yes, just as another writer wrote, the fresh ginger makes ALL the difference. Happy cooking!

Good fried rice, but it was a bit bland until we added some extra soy sauce and pepper to the servings on our plates. I also added a couple of eggs, which I Cooked right in the pan along with everything else, as most fried rice we’ve had at Chinese restaurants has eggs in it.

Actually this is the second time I’ve made this. the first time without the mushrooms and this time with mushrooms But I don’t think the mushrooms contributed much to the taste. Actually needs a little more soy sauce but I left it to the individual person to add to the plate. I did not have fresh ginger so I used powdered. We had a pork roast dinner last night then tonight I cubed up 2 cups chopped of the leftovers Both my husband and I thought it was an amazing meal
Super easy and a great way to use leftover pork!
The fresh ginger really is the key ingredient. Sooooo good and easy to make. If I had one criticism, it would be it needed eggs in it.
Amazing recipe with the Sweet Chili Thai Sauce. Without it, pretty bland. Must use the sauce! Family loved it, and so did I. :)
Delicious! I use sesame oil for more flavor, and add sesame seeds at the end. Such a quick and tasty meal.

Yea, this is a excellent recipe and I will make it again but made some changes to up the flavor, I used my home made Vodka-5 Spice about 2 tablespoons, 2 teaspoons Nuoc Mam (Fish Sauce) and the pork I had from a previous recipe in the freezer was Char Siu and then sprinkled a little Red Pepper Flakes to spice things up.
my husband says its a do over! I used 2 scrambled eggs and peas. no celery on chives. all though that would be good too. I also used brown rice.

I had some leftover pork roast and made this dish. Goes together really quickly and is very tasty. Leftovers are good too, although might need to double recipe if you want enough leftovers to have a second goround for the family. I had just enough the next day for a quick lunch for one person. I added a scrambled egg for a little more volume. Good eating!!
great base to work from what you have kicking around that needs to get cooked up. It needs pepper and any spices of choice, and egg if you got one, otherwise a bit bland.
Turned out great, however I am not a fan of the bell pepper so I used snow peas.
Quick, easy, and so delicious. I will make this over and over
Excellent as prescribed!

This is, unquestionably, the BEST fried rice we have ever had, commercial or homemade. I agree that the fresh ginger is key to the exceptional flavor. Perhaps the Basmati rice contributed, as well. I didn't make any notable changes, except to omit the red pepper and to double the soy sauce. This recipe is the very best!!! Oh and it requires 10 stars not 5.

Loved it Will definitely make again 
Hubby also loved this recipe
Had ginger flavored soy sauce so I used 1 Tbls of 
this and 2 Tbls plain soy sauce 
What a great way to use leftover pork tenderloin 
Thanks
Upped soy sauce to 4 T. Added a cup of peas, three scrambled eggs, sliced jalapenos, peanuts, scallions, cilantro.

I make this fairly often. One crucial missing ingredient, in my view, is several scrambled eggs. Make them slightly soft scrambled; the heat when you add them to the hot rice will finish them up. And for added flavor: a little butter in the oil, about 2 tsp sesame oil, and about 1-2 tsp MSG. Excellent! And of course adding other bits of meat is always good: shrimp, diced ham, chicken, etc.

I made this and had my mother -in-law over that night my husband and I loved it!! My mother-in -law said she would come back any time for it !!!!
 The only changes I made were I had to use ground ginger,I don't keep fresh on hand,minced garlic from the store I keep a large jar on hand and I had some fresh broccoli so I added that.
 Carrie thank you for sharing this tonight will be my third time making it!!!!
 I just serve it with egg rolls and soy sauce on the side.
easy great dish
easy recipe and quite good, although a little bland. used the vegetables we had on hand and it was a nice way to use leftover pork.
Loved it, hubby too. Great idea for leftover pork roast.
very delishios

Did not add the mushrooms. I used a bit of sesame oil and oyster sauce too. I made pork chops in the oven and they were so dry I thought I'd need to toss them. This recipe saved the the day and the $!
Excellent. Nice wit,h the added veggies. I think my guys ate it for breakfast. There was nothing left
So many options for the veggies you can use makes this recipe awesome ! I did not use mushrooms, but did use edamame. And I added a scrambled egg. Love this Pork Fried Rice !
All the preparation can be done ahead to create a healthy quick meal. Method is easy and prevents the rice from sticking to the pan.
My family loved it the recipe is simple and quick, everything a working mother needs.

I don't usually follow a recipe verbatim, this recipe is a great base. I added 2scrambled eggs, 1/3bag of shredded Cole slaw mix with carrots, I added an extra shredded carrot, celery and onion and frozen peas. Didn't have scallions. No leftovers, guess I'll just have to make it again.

This is a yummy meal, even the grandkids ate hearty. I did read the other comments and made just a slight adjustment of only using 4 cups cooked rice (6 cups cooked rice is way too much) and adding 3 scrambled eggs. I recommend to definitely add more soy sauce to your taste. I also added some Hoisin sauce for a little spice. I have never used fresh ginger, but it was definitely worth it. This would be great with broccoli. Will definitely make again!
very tasty and easy... you can easily change up the vegetables or meat
